I have been unable to reproduce this bug, but moving to SWT as an FYI - in case 
the stack trace is of use.
Could this be the "deeply nested tree expansion" problem?
No. The deeply nested expansion problem was for TableTree not Tree.

Chrix fixed a problem where we could get a null pointer in the dispose case.  
Please reopen if you get it again.
